Description: Apples are sweet, edible fruits produced by an apple tree. They come in a variety of colors, including red, green, and yellow. Apples are high in fiber and vitamin C.
Bananas are elongated, edible fruits produced by various kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants. They are rich in potassium, vitamin B6, and vitamin C.
Cherries are small, round fruits with a pit in the middle. They are sweet or sour in taste and are high in antioxidants, vitamin C, and fiber.
Dates are sweet fruits of the date palm tree. They are often dried and are a rich source of fiber, potassium, and magnesium.
Elderberries are small, dark berries that grow in clusters on the elderberry shrub. They are known for their high antioxidant content and potential immune-boosting properties.
Figs are sweet fruits with a unique texture, featuring a chewy flesh and crunchy seeds. They are rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals.
Grapes are small, round, and typically sweet fruits that grow in clusters. They can be eaten fresh or used to make wine, juice, and jelly. They are high in vitamins C and K.
Honeydew melons are large, round fruits with a smooth rind and sweet, juicy green flesh. They are a good source of vitamin C and potassium.
Kiwis are small, brown, fuzzy fruits with bright green or golden flesh. They are known for their tangy flavor and high vitamin C content.
Lemons are yellow, oval citrus fruits with a tart taste. They are high in vitamin C and are often used in cooking, baking, and beverages.
Mangoes are tropical stone fruits with a sweet and juicy flavor. They have a large pit in the center and are rich in vitamins A and C.
Nectarines are similar to peaches but have smooth skin. They are sweet and juicy, and are high in vitamins A and C, and potassium.
Oranges are round citrus fruits with a sweet and tangy taste. They are high in vitamin C and are commonly eaten fresh or juiced.
Papayas are tropical fruits with sweet, orange flesh and black seeds. They are rich in vitamins A and C, and digestive enzymes.
Quinces are yellow, pear-shaped fruits with a tart flavor. They are often used in cooking and making preserves and are high in vitamin C and fiber.
Raspberries are small, red or black berries with a sweet-tart flavor. They are high in fiber, vitamins C and K, and antioxidants.
Strawberries are bright red, juicy fruits with a sweet flavor. They are high in vitamin C, manganese, and antioxidants.
Tangerines are small, sweet citrus fruits with a deep orange color and easy-to-peel skin. They are high in vitamin C and fiber.
Ugli fruits are a type of tangelo with a rough, wrinkled skin and sweet-tart flavor. They are rich in vitamin C and fiber.
Watermelons are large fruits with a hard green rind and sweet, juicy red or yellow flesh. They are high in vitamins A and C, and hydrating properties.
Xigua, or Chinese watermelon, is similar to regular watermelon but smaller and with a darker rind. It is high in vitamins A and C, and is very hydrating.
Yellow passion fruits are round fruits with a tough, yellow rind and juicy, seed-filled interior. They are rich in vitamins A and C, and dietary fiber.
Though technically a fruit, zucchinis are often treated as vegetables. They are green, cylindrical, and high in vitamins A and C, and potassium.
